pros: One of the best employers I've worked for. Great benefits and competitive pay.
cons: A lot of processes are very manual. Good opportunities for automation in the future.

review_title: mixed bag - not a place to grow your career
pros: You are truly doing something that changes peoples life's. The science of the process is really fascinating. Some of the people are really nice to work with.
cons: Your experience will really vary and will depend on what you would do there. I really liked a lot of the people I worked with, but a few toxic people bring the entire place down. A job where you would work more or less by yourself like microbiology would probably not be that bad. If you're wanting to move up there it’s a lot of politicking that comes into play and people can be kinda to a lot of backstabbing if they also want the promotion. I found a lot of the job to be rewarding but there is this fake facade by upper management of we care about the gift (donor tissue) when in reality they care about the money and giving themselves bigger bonuses at the end of the year since they are a non-profit and the money needs to balance out at the end of the year. Some of the upper management that didn't have bachelor degrees and when they were forced to get them, the degrees were whichever bachelor degree was easiest to get for them. Then those people would be making very critical medical decisions or deciding on the direction of the company, and they did not have the background and/or education to be making such critical decisions. It's a mixed bag I worked there for almost 8 years and the negative wasn't noticeable till maybe after my first full year there since you have the rosy glasses on. If the money is good and you don’t have to work in central supply or the clean room area for production, then take the position. If your hope is to make it a long-term career and move up in the work place then there are better places to do then there.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Kettering, OH
pros: Learn a lot about tissue grafts Consistent hours
cons: Bad sexual harassment issues with no punishment Management is disconnected Pay needs to be more for the work done

review_title: Experience highly depends on what department and shift you work
job_title: Dental Processing Technician in Kettering, OH
pros: Dental, Birth tissue, and CNC departments are more relaxed. Management generally treats people well.
cons: Techs working in the traditional and cellular departments are over-worked and often treated badly by management, although some shifts are significantly better than others.

review_title: Incredible work opportunity, but be ready for social olympics
pros:
— Great entry pay, benefits, & health coverage 
 
— Comprehensive & continuing training/education, with access to otherwise-costly education programs, like CTBS & AATB resources 
 
— Very supportive Directors, HR, & upper management 
 
— Plenty of advancement headroom, also opens the door for a surprising amount of career opportunities in many adjacent directions 

— The company is actually generally agreeable in corporate practice, maintains a good-faith operation (in my opinion!) 
 
— Abundant functional accommodation; very understanding of illness/discomfort/extenuating circumstances, and some have chosen standing desk modifications
cons:
— Established and scrutinizing in-office culture. If you don't "fit in" or participate in the clique of a department, there is only one outcome for you, socially. I have witnessed an upsetting presence of drama, gossiping, and outright bullying. Grown adults teasing others and then manipulating the Director to slip by is just depressing. Everyone talks about everyone, and if you don't get "with it" or bow down, you WILL be humiliated. I have watched it happen and drive new hires out in 4- to 6-month cycles, and I can't say for certain whether that's part of the constant need to hire in this particular department. Either way, anyone can tell you there is social discord both present and prevalent. Unfortunately, I must add that I've also witnessed select employees entirely fabricate lies about others for some combination of entertainment and control, and at a couple points, jeopardizing their employment. 
 
— Highly unprofessional/inappropriate verbal chatter. At the risk of appearing prude, I do personally get uncomfortable after hearing about the sexual life of a narcissist and their Tinder personality analyses after the 8th or so instance per payroll. We also talk to the families of people who just had someone die, daily, and while it is rare that the noise level is an issue during those particular calls, I don't think it's asking too much to say the setting warrants those kinds of conversations to altogether be left to the private Teams chats they think nobody else knows they have. Raunchy, judging, and outright mean banter across the office is regular, encouraged, and of course, you become the target if you protest. 
 
— Not the company's fault, but given the location, there's simply no guarantees about vehicle safety or road closure/accessibility.

job_title: Processing Team Lead in Kettering, OH
pros: Good pay, yearly bonus and good benefits.
cons: There can be a lot of drama between coworkers. Not good communication between management and team members.

pros: Decent employees and potential growth in most departments.
cons: Management is not respected, there are some good people in management but most don’t know how to talk or compensate their employees. The environment was toxic but better you you stay to yourself and do your job. Seems very unorganized and money hungry vs caring for their employees. The hours/schedule is tough especially if you have children.

review_title: If Regina George and sadness had a baby... they'd name it CBCCTS
pros: They do things that save lives. Great place to work for white males.
cons: Never felt more unappreciated in my life. You can share great ideas and they will ignore you if the leaders didn't think of it themselves. Leadership group is very insecure and threatened by smart talent. Very gossipy and toxic. HR is worthless and contributes to the problems. Worst kept secrets: they watch your every move, even in the office, on camera. Also they read your messages, emails and chats and listen to your phone calls. If you tell them you can make more money elsewhere they will tell you to just go. CEO is a figment of your imagination.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Kettering, OH
pros: What you do at this company really can make a difference. Good place as a stepping stone for those who intend on making a career in the medical or mortuary field. Lots of different job options if you get tired of your department. Generous PTO policy. Yearly bonuses. 401k. High pay. Lots of entry level positions for those without any sort of degree.
cons: If you cannot work with bones, skin, blood, organs, or body parts in general, this job is not for you. Company claims they have a tuition assistance program but it's very specific, medical-oriented degrees that not everyone has an interest in. Leadership is very out of touch with "lower" employees, they lack a lot of perspective, even those in leadership who have started from the bottom and moved up in the company. Despite this company using several forms of communication, they still greatly struggle with communication, which results in employee confusion. Leadership claim they will work on communication, but never do. Leadership makes promises that they frequently break, a lot of employees have become accustomed to not keeping their hopes up on certain things. If you aren't an easily social person, you will be left out and excluded from things. Workplace bullying is a major issue here, and often gets ignored by leadership because it seems they're all afraid of confrontation. Minority employees (LGBT+, POC, disabled, neurodivergent, etc.) receive disrespectful treatment, despite a yearly enforced "harassment prevention" meeting. There are verbally abusive people who aren't afraid to be rude to their co-workers because they know nothing will be done about it. Gossip runs rampant, I don't think I even heard this much gossip when I was in high school. Leadership almost encourages the gossip and works with a two-faced attitude. There is a clear amount of favoritism among leadership and other employees. Less favored employees continually receive lectures, are told that their work speed isn't enough, and are berated over simple mistakes. 1st shift is held to an extreme standard, the other shifts (2nd, 3rd, and Weekends) are held to a "get away with murder" standard, and are hardly held accountable, despite earning much more pay than 1st shift. Leadership also has tendencies to micromanage to an extreme, and not let their workers take simple breaks. Several employees take more than 5 minutes in the bathroom, and are interrogated why they were gone for a long time. Your time clock patterns are scrutinized down to the minutes, even seconds. Cameras are used within every room of the building and any actions deemed "suspicious" will be thoroughly questioned, with a "guilty until proven innocent" mindset. Conversations get listened to by those eavesdropping nearby. You have no sense of actual privacy when discussing matters with people, leadership has repeatedly broken anonymity with issues. A coworker reported workplace bullying to a manager, in which the manager informed the bully the specific person who reported them, resulting in the person being confronted and harassed. The moment you become somewhat familiar with something in the job, you will be forced to train a new hire, despite it being something you're not fully comfortable with. Expressing this issue will result in you being berated and told to go to another department, and a group lecture from out of touch leadership (that does not do the work we do) saying: "Training is part of the job description. I'm going to need you to let go of your big egos and understand that. Get over yourselves." - Christina Watson, Manager of Dental Department All of this and leadership remains confused on why we have such a high rate of turnover (over 40%). For a non-profit company who strives to help save lives, it's almost not worth the mental turmoil.

pros: pay, benefits, friends and the bonus

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Kettering, OH

job_title: Tissue Receiving Specialist in Dayton, OH
pros:
This company truly helps people. Either on the blood side or tissue side, you will be helping save & improve lives.
Pay rates are good & because it is a non-profit, there is the possibility of a bonus each year.
For the first 24 months there is a pay bump every 6 months & Cost of Living increase each year.
cons: Research the department you are interviewing with before accepting the position. What I mean is be sure to go in with a list of questions to ask the interviewer and a list you want to ask those working there. Ask the department head you are interviewing with if you can talk to the others...in private. I wish I'd done this. I would have learned a lot before working there.

cons: You're expected to train yourself after about a month, relying on coworkers assistance when there are only a few other people on your shift. With no trainer, the whole team is your boss, and with everyone doing things slightly differently, it's hard to get a feel of how to do things correctly while also not feeling overwhelmed and nitpicked for small discretions. There are either 10 or 12 hour shifts, with only one 30 minute break. The Donor Referral Center is the rollover call center for the entire company, and there are anywhere from 20-30 tasks you're expected to master, with anywhere from 3-5 people on a shift.

job_title: Sterile Tissue Processing Technician in Kettering, OH
pros: Great benefits and several shifts to choose from: M-F 7am-3:30pm, M-F 3-11:30pm, M-F 11pm-7:30am, and when I worked there a Wednesday-Sunday 7am-3:30pm shift as well. Seems to be a lot of upward mobility within the company; I moved into a new position within a year. Benefits included health care, vision and dental, paid time off, 401(k), disability. Also the job itself is inspiring and you would be providing tissue grafts for a lot of people.
cons: Not flexible when it comes to schedule; for example you can't come in at 7:30 and leave at 4 or skip lunch to leave early. Also the pay wasn't great. First shift was always coveted but 2nd and 3rd shifts seemed to be able to "get away with" more since the supervisors and company heads all worked during the day. They are very strict with time in/time out, etc., whereas other jobs I've worked understand that one day you may be a few minutes late and another you may be early. I never had a time issue but saw a lot of people get disciplined over what I would consider pretty minor things. Overall a good company to work for if you like a job where you punch in, do the same things day after day, punch out and leave your work at work.

pros: None. I honestly cannot come up with any pros for Beckett. An unbelievably unprofessional environment.
cons: I worked at Beckett 3 days. Let me explain why. They hired me over the phone to begin with . Absolutely no interview. They just reviewed my resume and hired me over the phone. Then I did the restraint training which was unbelievably unprofessional. There were two instructors. One of which was throwing us new employees all over the place in a carpeted basement. One young woman landed on her head. One of the instructors was demonstrating a restraint on a young woman and actually stated to her, I can't get my arms around your fat butt." They also referred to the clients we would be working with as retards. Statements were used by the instructors like - "there just a bunch of retards." After 3 days of this nightmare, I caller HR and let the woman that I met with HR know the reason I was quitting. I hope she followed up on my complaints because it was a dangerous and highly disrespectful environment.

job_title: Program Manager in North Conway, NH
pros: Employment at Becket Family of Services is personally the most fulfilling work I have had in a long time. I look forward to the everyday challenges my work presents and feel extremly satisfied at the end of each day for all that was accompished. My co-workers all work together as team and management on every level show their appreciation in many different ways for the hard work that we do. The best part of my work is watching the successful steps (no matter how small) the individuals we work with achieve everyday and to know I helped in someway.  The company itself treats employees well and they are always invested in fun innovative team building activities for all staff to participate in.  The company works hard to promote from within so there are many opportunities for advancement.
cons: I haven't found a con about Becket Family of Services, the work we do is extremely rewarding.

review_title: Good training & pay, awesome opportunities to advance
pros: I didn't have much experience when I applied, but the company has provided me a ton of training (web based, internal, and external trainers) and some worthwhile certification courses. The starting pay for me was $12.00 per hour and I can usually sign up for overtime when I need some extra coin. Benefits are really good, although I don't use them all.  Being sort of a life coach for people who need it, is a bonus.
cons: Corporate level management is great, but some middle management isn't. Some of the clients can be challenging at times, although it's usually my co-workers being dumb that sets them off.

review_title: Great job if you are willing to put in the effort
pros: this company has been the only place that I feel my talents and ability have been noticed and developed.  Becket is always looking to get staff prepared for the next step in their career and with the company,  which is why most of the upper management were once staff themselves.   The company has great benefits and paid time off.  The individuals inside of the residences are great to work with and it is so rewarding to see the progress they make throughout your time supporting them.  I would encourage anyone who has a great work ethic and desire to push past the general mold of just being a staff member to join Becket Family Of Services.
cons: Sometimes it can be difficult to balance a work and family life due to the personal nature of the work that we do.

review_title: Great place to grow within the human services field
pros: Great health benefits and time off. Ability to grow within this field. Management encourages staff to work towards advancement. Good way to get your foot in the door within this field.
cons: The staff deserve to be paid better for the amount of work they put in especially when dealing with behaviors. Once you are employed you will find yourself with less of a social life. It is difficult to balance a life with family and friends while working overtime here. Some of the houses are managed by people who could care less about the well being of their staff and work place, however I was blessed with a supervisor who supports me and supports a healthy work environment.

pros: In residential life, there were plenty of opportunities to work overtime and make a little extra money. However, even that didn't last long and after three months of working there, employees' hours got cut to avoid excessive overtime.
cons: Where to begin...this company has very little respect for its employees, especially residential staff. The company boasted about having only 4-day work weeks, yet the demanding hours, working 2nd shift on Fridays, then a 15-16 hour shift every Saturday, was exhausting. The fact that they expected their employees to work such a shift, and often requiring them to drive 5-6 hours on the 15 hour shift was unbelievable. Another major factor was that they were not gender-conscious by any means, for example, pairing a young female counselor with a sexually defiant male resident. Overall, the job was mentally exhausting.

pros:
Becket gives you the chance to work within a close knit team
They Promote from within
With the right Management, its an overall positive work environment
cons:
Can be difficult at times to receive the clinical support and advice that is needed.
Depending on the program, Negativity from the management can create a poor work environment
High Turnover

pros: The pay is better then other companies in the area. Co workers are great and get along with each other
cons: Everything was fine then they came in changed everything including all of the starts schedules without caring about there families and made weekends mandatory and staff were told if they can't work it they can find a new job. Hired new pm without interviewing for position. It feels as though its floor staff vs higher ups which shouldn't be the case. No room to advance in company based on how things have been the last few months

pros: What I love about working at Becket is the feeling that I’m making a difference in the lives of the clients we serve. The support I receive from my team mates is fantastic. The feeling of being part of the Becket “family” is very rewarding!
cons: Of course some of the behaviors we deal with can be mentally taxing at times.

pros: As a youth Counselor the number of hours you can work are almost unlimited, they are always willing to give you overtime.
cons: The con's outweigh the pro's about 1000 to 1. The management here shows zero respect or loyalty towards its employees, they view you as disposable. The male youth you are working with are unpredictable and do not show regard for any type of human safety. Spitting, fighting, urinating, drug abuse racial comments....the list goes on. A very mentally draining job. The day I walked out of there was one of the best days of my life.

pros: This company is great. Lots of overtime, staff are great, rewarding field. Benefits are alright, lots of vacation time.
cons: No holiday, can be very stressful at times. Pay isn't all that great, however if you put in the work And dedication it will be worth it

pros: The children  are the only thing good
cons: Where do I begin : Frat house like setting the staff have very little boundaries when it comes to the children ( they treat them like trash or are their best friend ) depending on who they like at the moment - The staff all know each other managers, co managers, and supervisors are all in relationships with one another ( director and lead staff are engaged ) ( managers and those they manage are married in relationships or cohabitating ) many have children together ! If a kid is having a hard time and acts out at a husband / wife the other party gets offended and gives the kid a real hard time - the food is abysmal on the weekends ( there is no set meal time and the kids eat whenever ) mostly frozen foods / the kids will spend their own money on takeout whenever possible due to the poor quality of food - the managers and director have NO problem yelling obscenities at the kids - they take CERTAIN kids on trips - they want you to drive alone alot with children ( think that is a risk to both staff and children ) as anything at anytime could be said - I was there for a short amount of time and the accusations run wild ( sexual accusations ) against female staff are prevelent happened 4 times in two months *** concerning *** to say the least - the kids know if they don't want to work with a female staff they can accuse them of something and they will no longer work together - like I said a frat house -

pros: Management is very supportive of their workers and all are treated with respect and dignity.  Management are always willing to assist you in personal growth and offer ongoing trainings to better your job skills.
cons: Its disappointing when your unable to help  youth as I take it as a personal defeat.

pros: Great management, friendly staff. Everyone works together for the benefit of the clients. Excellent benefits. Free meals if you like what is being served.
cons: Sometimes the clients act out. If you are assigned to a client who has a job you may get stuck standing for 6 hours of your shift while he works. Occasionally staff likes to gossip.

pros: Room for growth, training in on point, open door communication with leadership. Becket sticks to their values and respects the rights of all clients that hey serve as respects the staff that they employ. Multiple training to assist staff in growth and development. Generous employee benefits.
cons: The one con that I have is that the pay could be better.

pros:
-Ability to rise to leadership positions within the organization.
-Strong leadership 
-Will have the opportunity to change the lives of our clients everyday
-competitive pay and overtime
-flexible schedule
-strong benefits
cons:
-There can be drama at times within the programs, but strong leadership should put a stop to this if it ocurs.
-The work is hard, however, it is rewarding.

pros:
Opportunity to grow within company.
Open communication with supervisors.
Team effort.
cons:
Pay is low for entry level and managers.
Staff turn over. 
Unclear expectations of job duties.

job_title: Behavioral Health Professional in Portland, ME
pros: Nice people to work with, good training opportunities and plenty of support with frequent meetings. Very rewarding to work with the kids.
cons: It can be a draining job. Can be difficult to manage the schools goals and the treatment team’s goals.

pros:
- Good benefits
- Great staff
- Meaningful work
- Independence
- Flexible schedule
- Understanding supervisor
cons:
- Low pay, like all of social work
- No idea who the people in the other offices are

review_title: Amazing place to work with tremendous individuals who perform exceptional treatment.
pros: Impact on the community and clients is exceptional. Very supportive from youth counsellors to upper management.
cons:
I have nothing negative to say about the
Company. I am fully satisfied and fulfill my goals everyday with their support.

pros: The program concept is great and I feel it helps reduce recidivism while giving therapy and strategies for success.
cons: always short on staff and staff getting stressed out from working too much.

pros: Becket family of services has been providing me with consistent work since I started. They offered me a fair wage and opportunities for overtime. They even offer a referral bonus. This company has been great!
cons: Communication isn't always the best.

pros: None whatsoever. Please go work somewhere else where you will be appreciated and compensated for your hard work. This isn't the place.
cons: This is a very crappy company to work for. High turnover rate with low pay. Management is incompetent. They think they can fire anyone. Management turnover is high. Everytime there is new management, they hire their own staff probably to cover their own butts.

review_title: Bettter hourly pay than other residential programs
pros: Very little to no experience needed
cons: Very difficult to be a productive worker when your leaders do not lead by example. Staffing issues. Hard to keep workers. Thankless job.

job_title: Individual and Family Psychotherapist in Manchester Center, VT
pros: Great team and nurturing environment. Training is ample and effective. Pay is about average for the area.
cons: The population served can be quite intense and overwhelming at time. The area is remote.

pros: You get to go hiking and do outdoor stuff with the kids.
cons: These kids are extremely violent. You will be alone with them to drive them to home visits and hiking etc and that is very scary cause they are violent and mentally ill.

review_title: A little mismanaged....but a good company to work for
job_title: Residetial Youth Counselor in Campton, NH
pros:
-Rewarding work
-Great clinical staff to work with
-Decent pay
cons:
-Poor communication when changes/different expectations take place
-Not all management are on the same page

pros: Support from peers and supervisors, excellent benefits, great career for a people's person.
cons: I haven't encountered any yet.

pros: Rewarding, challenging work, good experience
cons: Coworkers aren't the brightest

pros: Rewarding, fun, help children deal with problems on a daily basis.

pros: Good experience, easy work, free food

pros: The manager is flexible but doesn't back you up
